an4.234:1.1: Then Sikhāmoggallāna the brahmin went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
an4.234:1.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Sikhāmoggallāna sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha:
an4.234:2.1: “Master Gotama, a few days ago the student Soṇakāyana came to me and said:
an4.234:2.2: ‘The ascetic Gotama advocates not doing any deeds. So he teaches the annihilation of the world!’
an4.234:2.3: The world exists through deeds, and it remains because deeds are undertaken.”
an4.234:3.1: “Brahmin, I can’t recall even seeing the student Soṇakāyana,
an4.234:3.2: so how could we possibly have had such a discussion?
an4.234:3.3: I declare these four kinds of deeds, having realized them with my own insight.
an4.234:3.5: There are dark deeds with dark results;
an4.234:3.7: dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results; and
an4.234:3.8: neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.
an4.234:4.1: And what are the dark deeds with dark results?
an4.234:4.2: It’s when someone makes hurtful choices by way of body, speech, and mind. …
an4.234:4.5: Touched by hurtful contacts, they experience hurtful feelings that are exclusively painful—like the beings in hell.
an4.234:4.6: These are called dark deeds with dark results.
an4.234:5.1: And what are bright deeds with bright results?
an4.234:5.2: It’s when someone makes pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind. …
an4.234:5.5: Touched by pleasing contacts, they experience pleasing feelings that are exclusively happy—like the gods replete with glory.
an4.234:5.6: These are called bright deeds with bright results.
an4.234:6.1: And what are dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results?
an4.234:6.2: It’s when someone makes both hurtful and pleasing choices by way of body, speech, and mind. …
an4.234:6.5: Touched by both hurtful and pleasing contacts, they experience both hurtful and pleasing feelings that are a mixture of pleasure and pain—like humans, some gods, and some beings in the underworld.
an4.234:6.6: These are called dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results.
an4.234:7.1: And what are neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds?
an4.234:7.2: It’s the intention to give up dark deeds with dark results, bright deeds with bright results, and both dark and bright deeds with both dark and bright results.
an4.234:7.3: These are called neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds.
an4.234:7.4: These are the four kinds of deeds that I declare, having realized them with my own insight.”
